org.matrix.androidsdk.call

Class MXCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.androidsdk.call.MXCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMXCall
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MXChromeCall, MXWebRtcCall

    public class MXCall
extends Object
implements IMXCall
    This class is the default implementation

        The room in which the call is performed.

      • mCallSignalingRoom

        protected Room mCallSignalingRoom
        The room in which the call events are sent. It might differ from mCallingRoom if it is a conference call. For a 1:1 call, it will be equal to mCallingRoom.

      • mCallListeners

        private final ArrayList<IMXCall.MXCallListener> mCallListeners

      • switchRearFrontCamera

        public boolean switchRearFrontCamera()
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Switch between device cameras. The transmitted stream is modified according to the new camera in use. If the camera used in the video call is the front one, calling switchRearFrontCamera(), will make the rear one to be used, and vice versa. If only one camera is available, nothing is done.
        Specified by:
        switchRearFrontCamera in interface IMXCall
        Returns:
        true if the switch succeed, false otherwise.

      • isCameraSwitched

        public boolean isCameraSwitched()
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Indicate if a camera switch was performed or not. For some reason switching the camera from front to rear and vice versa, could not be performed (ie. only one camera is available).


        See IMXCall.switchRearFrontCamera().

        Specified by:
        isCameraSwitched in interface IMXCall
        Returns:
        true if camera was switched, false otherwise

      • isSwitchCameraSupported

        public boolean isSwitchCameraSupported()
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Indicate if the device supports camera switching.

        See IMXCall.switchRearFrontCamera().

        Specified by:
        isSwitchCameraSupported in interface IMXCall
        Returns:
        true if switch camera is supported, false otherwise

      • muteVideoRecording

        public void muteVideoRecording(boolean isVideoMuted)
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Mute/Unmute the recording of the local video attendee. Set isVideoMuted to true to enable the recording of the video, if set to false no recording is performed.
        Specified by:
        muteVideoRecording in interface IMXCall
        Parameters:
        isVideoMuted - true to mute the video recording, false to unmute

      • isVideoRecordingMuted

        public boolean isVideoRecordingMuted()
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Return the recording mute status of the local video attendee.


        See IMXCall.muteVideoRecording(boolean).

        Specified by:
        isVideoRecordingMuted in interface IMXCall
        Returns:
        true if video recording is muted, false otherwise
